pullRequest.body:
Remove the `Integrable` assumption of `integral_condexp` and add the total probability law using `condexp` as conditional probability.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [41f68b09d6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13932/commits/41f68b09d628c241c7a1ccdb009d1c9a2f266ac1)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ integral_condexp_indicator`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Actually instead of applying all the golfing suggestions above, here is a short proof of your lemma:
```lean
/-- Total probability law using `condexp` as conditional probability. -/
theorem total_law_condexp [mF : MeasurableSpace F] {Y : α → F} (hY : Measurable Y)
    [IsProbabilityMeasure μ] {A : Set α} (hA : MeasurableSet[mF.comap Y] A) :
    (μ A).toReal = ∫ x, (μ[(A.indicator fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ)) | mF.comap Y]) x ∂μ := by
  have hAm0 : MeasurableSet A := hY.comap_le A hA
  have total_exp : ∫ x, (μ[A.indicator fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ)|mF.comap Y]) x ∂μ
      = ∫ x, A.indicator (fun x ↦ 1) x ∂ μ :=
    integral_condexp (measurable_iff_comap_le.mp hY) ((integrable_const _).indicator hAm0)
  rw [total_exp, integral_indicator hAm0, setIntegral_const, smul_eq_mul, mul_one]
```
(Please still read my comments about the name and the assumptions)
This lemma seems strange to me as you assume `MeasurableSet[mF.comap Y] A` and so the conditional expectation does not do anything to the indicator. Perhaps you only want `MeasurableSet A`?

Thank you @RemyDegenne  for all your suggestions. I used your shorter proof and changed the name. I have taken note of all previous suggestions for future proofs, thanks.
@JasonKYi: Indeed, I changed the hypothesis to only `MeasurableSet A`, thanks!

Please check every comment above and mark as resolved all those that you addressed. If something remains (like my comment about switching the two sides of the equality in the result of the lemma, or my question about finite measures), please address those.
Sorry for that. I think it's good now.

`integral_condexp` can be generalized so that you don't need integrability. Namely 
```lean
lemma foo {α : Type u_1} {F' : Type u_3}
  [NormedAddCommGroup F'] [NormedSpace ℝ F'] [CompleteSpace F']
  {m : MeasurableSpace α} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α}
  (f : α → F') (hm : m ≤ m0) [hμm : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite (μ.trim hm)] :
∫ (x : α), MeasureTheory.condexp m μ f x ∂μ = ∫ (x : α), f x ∂μ := by
  by_cases hf : MeasureTheory.Integrable f μ
  · exact integral_condexp hm hf
  · simp only [condexp_undef hf, Pi.zero_apply, integral_zero, integral_undef hf]
```
Can you generalize `integral_condexp` and then you can require sigma finite instead of finite measure.

> `integral_condexp` can be generalized so that you don't need integrability. Namely
> 
> ```lean
> lemma foo {α : Type u_1} {F' : Type u_3}
>   [NormedAddCommGroup F'] [NormedSpace ℝ F'] [CompleteSpace F']
>   {m : MeasurableSpace α} {m0 : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α}
>   (f : α → F') (hm : m ≤ m0) [hμm : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite (μ.trim hm)] :
> ∫ (x : α), MeasureTheory.condexp m μ f x ∂μ = ∫ (x : α), f x ∂μ := by
>   by_cases hf : MeasureTheory.Integrable f μ
>   · exact integral_condexp hm hf
>   · simp only [condexp_undef hf, Pi.zero_apply, integral_zero, integral_undef hf]
> ```
> 
> Can you generalize `integral_condexp` and then you can require sigma finite instead of finite measure.

Thank you! I did it and modified few proofs consequently. However, I'm wondering if it's possible to have a "nicer" assumption than `[SigmaFinite (μ.trim (measurable_iff_comap_le.mp hY))]`.

> Thank you! I did it and modified few proofs consequently. However, I'm wondering if it's possible to have a "nicer" assumption than `[SigmaFinite (μ.trim (measurable_iff_comap_le.mp hY))]`.

Sigma-finite with respect to the sub-sigma-algebra is the minimal assumption under which conditional expectations exist, if I recall correctly. The book Analysis in Banach Spaces, by Hytönen et al, is a good reference.

If your measure is finite, then the typeclass inference system will infer that for you, so the fact that it is somewhat complicated does not matter much.

> Sigma-finite with respect to the sub-sigma-algebra is the minimal assumption under which conditional expectations exist, if I recall correctly. The book Analysis in Banach Spaces, by Hytönen et al, is a good reference.

Ok I see. Indeed, it seems to be a fair assumption. I'll check this reference, thanks!

> If your measure is finite, then the typeclass inference system will infer that for you, so the fact that it is somewhat complicated does not matter much.

Indeed, it should be good for most classical usage I guess.

Thanks! 
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by JasonKYi.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9625587610/job/26550626227)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9625587610/job/26550626156)
Thanks!

`measurable_iff_comap_le.mp hY` could be written `hY.comap_le`, but actually you don't need the sigma-finite assumption at all, since it follows from the probability measure assumption:
```suggestion
    [IsProbabilityMeasure μ] {A : Set α} (hA : MeasurableSet[mF.comap Y] A) :
```

```suggestion
    (μ A).toReal = ∫ x, (μ[(indicator A fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ)) | mF.comap Y]) x ∂μ := by
```

```suggestion
  have hAm0 : MeasurableSet A := hY.comap_le A hA
```

This suggestion should not be applied because another one removes that code entirely, but I keep it for the style comment: don't go to a new line inside `rw[...]`.
```suggestion
  rw [integral_eq_lintegral_of_nonneg_ae ae_pos aestronglyMeasurable_const,
    ENNReal.ofReal_one, set_lintegral_one A]
```

This suggestion should not be applied because another one removes that code entirely, but here is a shorter proof:
```suggestion
  have ae_pos : 0 ≤ᵐ[μ.restrict A] (fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ)) := ae_of_all _ (fun _ ↦ by positivity)
```

```suggestion
  rw [total_exp, integral_indicator hAm0, setIntegral_const, smul_eq_mul, mul_one]
```

We usually choose names that describe more closely the objects in the result of the lemma. Also the lemmas are written with the complicated expression on the left of the = sign.
Switch the two sides of the conclusion and call it something like `integral_condexp_indicator`?

```suggestion
      have rmv_norm : ∀ a : α, ‖A.indicator (fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ)) a‖₊ =
          A.indicator (fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ≥0∞)) a := by
        intro a
        rw [nnnorm_indicator_eq_indicator_nnnorm]
        simp
```

Exactly the same proof, written in a compact way:
```suggestion
    have hAEmα : AEStronglyMeasurable (A.indicator (fun _ ↦ (1 : ℝ))) μ :=
      ((stronglyMeasurable_const.indicator hA).mono hY.comap_le).aestronglyMeasurable
```

It saves you a single `Set.` in the code. That does not seem worth it. You can event replace that `Set.indicator A` by `A.indicator`.
```suggestion
```
Can you extend the result to a finite measure instead of probability measure?

```suggestion
    [SigmaFinite (μ.trim hY.comap_le)] {A : Set α} (hA : MeasurableSet A) :
```
Oh right, thanks again
Can you put this right after `integral_condexp`? Since it's a consequence of that lemma, they should go together.

```suggestion
  by_cases hf : Integrable f μ
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory/Function/ConditionalExpectation): relax `integral_condexp` assumption and add `integral_condexp_indicator`
